result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian L Mallam was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Brian L Mallam in court with attorney James Jay Rennicke.  Defendant Brian L Mallam in custody.  Angeline E. Winton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
11:03 am Court recites case & appearances; ADA Winton - prob cause determination based upon complaint, includes sworn statement of officer & attachments, booking identification; Atty Rennicke - objects, not sufficient; Court ?'s Atty Rennicke - obj noted for the record; Court reviews complaint and attachments, court finds prob. cause, bound over for trial; ADA Winton tenders Information to court; Court recites Cts & penalties; Atty R - waives reading, pleads NG; Court - NG as to Cts 1-3; subst. 4/25, defense motions 5/30; Atty R - status Mon. at 10:45 am; Court - status 3/31 at 10:45 am.   ADA Winton - new charges, need bail today;  
states new charges & requests reinstating $1000 cash bond 14 CF 37 w/ add'l - no contact with Erlichmans, absolute sobriety, no alcohol, no contact with Erlichman's residence, no controlled substance unless prescribed by lic'd physician.  11:12 am Recess.  
11:18 am Back on record, Atty R - set up counseling, etc., 2 jobs; Court - statement, $1500 cash, no alcohol, no controlled sub unless subscribed, no contact w/S. Mallam, no contact with Ms. Sousuk, no contact with Erlichmans or their residence.   Appearance on 3/31 at 10:45 a.m.  Remanded to custody of sheriff.  Adj'd 11:20 am.  Status conference scheduled for March 31, 2014 at 10:45 am.

Defendant Brian L Mallam in court with attorney Martin Jarvis.  Defendant Brian L Mallam in custody.  Thomas Henry Frost appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. Also has 14CF18,14CF17,13CM213.  Court calls case and reviews the new charges. Mr. Mallam pleads guilty to count 3. Waives time limits for a preliminary exam. 
State does not want Mr. Mallam to get out of jail as he has mulitple charges for bail jumping. Atty Jarvis speaks regarding the bail. Court reviews the bail conditions. Court amends the bail to $250.00 cash, $1,000.00 signature. No contact with Sarah Mallam or children not more than 500 feet from premisis.  Preliminary hearing for 14CF37 scheduled for March 25, 2014 at 11:00 am.
$1,000 cash; no contact w/Sarah Mallam or children at the home.  Return date 3/14/14 at 1 p.m.
